title: hesper_class
text: hespeR package provides set S7 classes structure validate incoming survey data. restrictive? Restricting classes ensures valid operations performed, prevents accidental misuse, allows development reusable readable methods, towards semi-automated reports. design makes easier extend functionality methods needed. said, helper functions provided convert base R objects (e.g., data frames, lists) linked default template XML Kobo tool.

previous_headings: Overview of hespeR S7 Classes > Main Classes
title: hesper_class
text: Represents single HESPER item. Main features note : - hesper_var: variable name HESPER item vector corresponds. - hesper_vals: values variable. can contain NA values allow_missing = TRUE. ’ve just seen printed @hesper_bins property. getter function adds @hesper_bins object, binary indicators (1/0) possible response option. Binary variables useful analysis (faster, simpler). access values instance, can simply run hv@hesper_vals S7::props(hv, "hesper_vals"). Note hesper_vals hesper_var can take certain set values, otherwise error thrown. ensure valid data processed. Values stored functions returning character vectors.
code: hv <- HesperVector(   hesper_var = "hesper_food",   hesper_vals = c(     "no_serious_problem",     "serious_problem",     NA,     "dnk",     "pnta",     "serious_problem"   ),   allow_missing = TRUE ) hv #> <hespeR::HesperVector> #>  @ hesper_var   : chr "hesper_food" #>  @ hesper_vals  : chr [1:6] "no_serious_problem" "serious_problem" NA "dnk" "pnta" ... #>  @ allow_missing: logi TRUE #>  @ hesper_bins  :List of 5 #>  .. $ serious_problem   : int [1:6] 0 1 NA 0 0 1 #>  .. $ no_serious_problem: int [1:6] 1 0 NA 0 0 0 #>  .. $ dnk               : int [1:6] 0 0 NA 1 0 0 #>  .. $ pnta              : int [1:6] 0 0 NA 0 1 0 #>  .. $ not_applicable    : int [1:6] 0 0 NA 0 0 0 # Variables/items hesper_vars() #>  [1] "hesper_drinking_water"     "hesper_food"               #>  [3] "hesper_shelter"            "hesper_toilet"             #>  [5] "hesper_clean"              "hesper_clean_female"       #>  [7] "hesper_clothes_etc"        "hesper_income_livelihood"  #>  [9] "hesper_health"             "hesper_health_care_male"   #> [11] "hesper_health_care_female" "hesper_distress"           #> [13] "hesper_safety"             "hesper_education"          #> [15] "hesper_care"               "hesper_support"            #> [17] "hesper_separation"         "hesper_displaced"          #> [19] "hesper_information"        "hesper_aid"                #> [21] "hesper_respect"            "hesper_movement"           #> [23] "hesper_time"               "hesper_law"                #> [25] "hesper_gbv"                "hesper_drug"               #> [27] "hesper_mental_health"      "hesper_care_community"     #> [29] "hesper_other"  # Values/options hesper_opts() #> [1] "serious_problem"    "no_serious_problem" "dnk"                #> [4] "pnta"               "not_applicable"

previous_headings: Overview of hespeR S7 Classes > Main Classes
title: hesper_class
text: list HesperVector objects, representing set variables individual group. inherits validator HesperVector adds checks (instance checks duplicated HESPER item names different lengths vectors values).
code: hv2 <- HesperVector(   hesper_var = "hesper_displaced",   hesper_vals = c(     "no_serious_problem",     "serious_problem",     "no_serious_problem",     "dnk",     "pnta",     "serious_problem"   ),   allow_missing = TRUE ) hl <- HesperList(hesper_list = list(hv, hv2)) hl #> <hespeR::HesperList> #>  @ hesper_list:List of 2 #>  .. $ : <hespeR::HesperVector> #>  ..  ..@ hesper_var   : chr "hesper_food" #>  ..  ..@ hesper_vals  : chr [1:6] "no_serious_problem" "serious_problem" NA "dnk" ... #>  ..  ..@ allow_missing: logi TRUE #>  ..  ..@ hesper_bins  :List of 5 #>  .. .. .. $ serious_problem   : int [1:6] 0 1 NA 0 0 1 #>  .. .. .. $ no_serious_problem: int [1:6] 1 0 NA 0 0 0 #>  .. .. .. $ dnk               : int [1:6] 0 0 NA 1 0 0 #>  .. .. .. $ pnta              : int [1:6] 0 0 NA 0 1 0 #>  .. .. .. $ not_applicable    : int [1:6] 0 0 NA 0 0 0 #>  .. $ : <hespeR::HesperVector> #>  ..  ..@ hesper_var   : chr "hesper_displaced" #>  ..  ..@ hesper_vals  : chr [1:6] "no_serious_problem" "serious_problem" "no_serious_problem" "dnk" ... #>  ..  ..@ allow_missing: logi TRUE #>  ..  ..@ hesper_bins  :List of 5 #>  .. .. .. $ serious_problem   : int [1:6] 0 1 0 0 0 1 #>  .. .. .. $ no_serious_problem: int [1:6] 1 0 1 0 0 0 #>  .. .. .. $ dnk               : int [1:6] 0 0 0 1 0 0 #>  .. .. .. $ pnta              : int [1:6] 0 0 0 0 1 0 #>  .. .. .. $ not_applicable    : int [1:6] 0 0 0 0 0 0

previous_headings: Overview of hespeR S7 Classes > Main Classes
title: hesper_class
text: Often, variables collected part survey, instance demographic variables respondent household. variables can used define skip logic rules, specifying certain HESPER items set missing based values variables. examples : person children, 12th HESPER item education children set missing; , healthcare, different questions depending gender respondent (e.g. access maternal healthcare); , 16th HESPER item displacement home asked suffered forced displacement. , need class define skip logic rules, specifying values set missing based variables.
code: sl_rule <- SL(   hesper_var = "hesper_displaced",   subset_var = "pop_group",   subset_vals = c("host", "non_displaced") ) sl_rule #> <hespeR::SL> #>  @ hesper_var : chr "hesper_displaced" #>  @ subset_var : chr "pop_group" #>  @ subset_vals: chr [1:2] "host" "non_displaced"

previous_headings: Overview of hespeR S7 Classes > Main Classes
title: hesper_class
text: Eventually, last class HesperListEnhanced extends HesperList adding skip logic (SL). initial method used added object apply_hesper_list_sl(), applies skip logic rules HesperListEnhanced object, setting values NA appropriate return object -self.
code: hle <- HesperListEnhanced(   hesper_list = hl@hesper_list,   other_list = list(     pop_group = c("host", "refugee", "non_displaced", "host", "refugee", "host")   ),   SL = list(sl_rule) ) hle <- apply_hesper_list_sl(hle) hle #> <hespeR::HesperListEnhanced> #>  @ hesper_list:List of 2 #>  .. $ hesper_food     : <hespeR::HesperVector> #>  ..  ..@ hesper_var   : chr "hesper_food" #>  ..  ..@ hesper_vals  : chr [1:6] "no_serious_problem" "serious_problem" NA "dnk" ... #>  ..  ..@ allow_missing: logi TRUE #>  ..  ..@ hesper_bins  :List of 5 #>  .. .. .. $ serious_problem   : int [1:6] 0 1 NA 0 0 1 #>  .. .. .. $ no_serious_problem: int [1:6] 1 0 NA 0 0 0 #>  .. .. .. $ dnk               : int [1:6] 0 0 NA 1 0 0 #>  .. .. .. $ pnta              : int [1:6] 0 0 NA 0 1 0 #>  .. .. .. $ not_applicable    : int [1:6] 0 0 NA 0 0 0 #>  .. $ hesper_displaced: <hespeR::HesperVector> #>  ..  ..@ hesper_var   : chr "hesper_displaced" #>  ..  ..@ hesper_vals  : chr [1:6] NA "serious_problem" NA NA ... #>  ..  ..@ allow_missing: logi TRUE #>  ..  ..@ hesper_bins  :List of 5 #>  .. .. .. $ serious_problem   : int [1:6] NA 1 NA NA 0 NA #>  .. .. .. $ no_serious_problem: int [1:6] NA 0 NA NA 0 NA #>  .. .. .. $ dnk               : int [1:6] NA 0 NA NA 0 NA #>  .. .. .. $ pnta              : int [1:6] NA 0 NA NA 1 NA #>  .. .. .. $ not_applicable    : int [1:6] NA 0 NA NA 0 NA #>  @ SL         :List of 1 #>  .. $ : <hespeR::SL> #>  ..  ..@ hesper_var : chr "hesper_displaced" #>  ..  ..@ subset_var : chr "pop_group" #>  ..  ..@ subset_vals: chr [1:2] "host" "non_displaced" #>  @ other_list :List of 1 #>  .. $ pop_group: chr [1:6] "host" "refugee" "non_displaced" "host" ...

code: pak::pak("gnoblet/hespeR")

title: R Handle of The Humanitarian Emergency Settings Perceived Needs Scale (HESPER)
text: hespeR provides tools handling, cleaning, analyzing HESPER survey data R. includes classes representing HESPER data, functions checking validating datasets, utilities common wrangling tasks.

title: R Handle of The Humanitarian Emergency Settings Perceived Needs Scale (HESPER)
text: HesperList, HesperListEnhanced, HesperVector structured data handling. check_missing_vars, check_values_in_set, check_vars_in_set, check_vecs_in_set, check_vector_class, check_dupes hesper_opts, hesper_vars, rec_hesper_opts msg_invalid_values, msg_missing_vars Functions wrangling cleaning HESPER data.

title: R Handle of The Humanitarian Emergency Settings Perceived Needs Scale (HESPER)
text: See vignette full workflow example: vignette("hesper_class", package = "hespeR")
code: library(hespeR)  # Example: Check for missing variables in a data frame result <- check_missing_vars(df, required_vars = c("hesper_item1", "hesper_item2")) print(result)

text: hesper_list (list[HesperVector]) list HesperList items, representing HESPER item allowed options.

title: S7 class for hespeR list of vectors — HesperList
text: (S7_object) S7 object class HesperList, representing list HESPER vectors.

title: S7 class for hespeR list of vectors — HesperList
text: HesperList class designed encapsulate collection HESPER vectors. vector list instance HesperVector class, representing specific HESPER item allowed options. class validates item list valid HesperVector list empty, duplicated HESPER items, different lengths hesper_vals, consistent allow_missing values across items.

title: S7 class for hespeR vectors — HesperVector
text: (S7_object) S7 HesperVector object representing HESPER item allowed options.

title: S7 class for hespeR vectors — HesperVector
text: HesperVector class designed encapsulate core properties HESPER data. includes name HESPER item (hesper_var) vector allowed options item (hesper_vals). class validates hesper_var property valid Hesper item (see hesper_vars) values hesper_vals within allowed options (see specified hesper_opts). hesper_bins property getter add list binary vectors HESPER item. possible HESPER option (hesper_opts()), returns binary vector indicating values hesper_vals match option.
